intro: Reseda alba var. propinqua, commonly known as white eryngo, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, yellow to white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Reseda alba var. propinqua is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in herbal medicine.
